reviewText: Steve Catlin (Harry Hamlin- CLASH OF THE TITANS) is an off-road racer, and total pig. His latest marriage is crumbling, heading toward divorce. Steve just can't let that happen. His wife, Joyce (Faith Ford) winds up dead in a terrible "medical incident". Steve has her body cremated quicker than you can say, "poison-induced organ failure"! Steve's last ex-wife, Edie is suspicious, but no one else seems to share her concerns. Meanwhile, old Steve has moved on, and started up a new romance w/ the daughter of a race competitor. Seemingly within seconds, the two are married, but dad doesn't appear to be overly thrilled. It takes no time at all for Steve to prove his a$$-holiness to his latest bride. She begins blubbering, upsetting Steve, and, well... let's just say that she gets real sick, real fast! Yep, it's time for another funeral. Edie finally finds a sympathetic cop from Fresno. Working together, the two set out to nail Steve for his lethal activities. Based on a true story, MURDER SO SWEET is a well-made TV thriller. Hamlin is perfectly detestable in his sociopathic role. Also stars Ed Lauter (MAGIC, CUJO) as racer, Glen Emery; and Eileen Brennan is excellent as Steve's doomed mum, who has a few dark secrets of her own. This is a great human monster story...
Title: Murder So Sweet VHS

reviewText: How bad is this guy. An abusive cold killer that no one knew until the near end. I thought is was a little boring in the begin give it a chance.
Title: Murder So Sweet VHS

reviewText: Great "based on a true story" movie. I love it when justice prevails. Started out a bit cheesy but stick with it cause it gets better and better. There are those who think they can commit crimes behind closed doors but not this time...
Title: Murder So Sweet VHS

reviewText: Well done and entertaining (enough.)  I didn't expect anything stellar, but I doubt the creators of this Lifetime channel type show were out to set the world on fire here.  It's a typical "rainy Sunday afternoon" time-passer show.  With that said, it is entertaining in a blase sort of way. Hamlin is excellent as usual and does a great job portraying a psychopath, which is always fun to see (juxtaposed against his L.A. Law character, especially.)  If you have not got a whole heck of a lot to do and want to be mildly but pleasantly entertained, this is pretty good.  The cast is A list, so the acting does not disappoint.
Title: Murder So Sweet VHS

reviewText: I'll TRY to watch anything that has Harry Hamlin in it.  what a shame he waited so long to take a role like his in Mad Men.  I didn't even recognize him till I was well into that series.  More, more, more!

reviewText: I'm sick of these movies. Within three minutes of this cheapie; you know it's a time waster. Sad to see Hamlin so good in LA Law sink to this level. Nothing clever,bad acting; that's my view. I was more interested in the "Home Depot" flyer than this trash.

reviewText: This movie is not worthy of ONE star!  It deserves a ZERO!  Corny, and poorly acted.  I was bored out of my mind.  In fact, I couldn't sit through the whole thing.  Harry Hamlin is a DROLL, unconvincing actor ... How did he get a movie role? Even a GRADE C- one, such as this? And the other, MEDIOCRE has-been's should stay in a closet, where they'd be well hidden. Whomever wrote this screenplay should be shot! A BIG WASTE OF TIME.
